Experience the full computational power of Pebble Time with this real-time ray tracing application.
Everything is computed by the watch itself on the fly.
Rotate the view to see the beauty of the reflections, change the textures on demand.
- UP/DOWN : Rotate the view left or right
- SELECT : cycle through the 3 different texture of the ground plane

data.description:
Use your Pebble to find the closest stations to find a bike to rent or an available stand to return your bike!

"Share a bike" uses geolocation to find your gps position and public API's to get stations data. It displays a map using OSM.

It works in:
* Boston - Hubway
* London - Barclays Cycle Hire (Boris Bike)
* Lyon - Velov
* Minneapolis - Nice Ride
* Montreal - Bixi
* Ottawa - Capital Bixi
* New York City - NYC Citi Bike
* Paris - Velib
* San Francisco - Bay Area Bike Share
* Toronto - Bixi
* Washington DC - Capital Bikeshare

And many other cities: http://shareabike.jayps.fr/map.php
data.title: Share a bike

We understand that your timer is an integral part of your daily workflow; if you have any input to share, we want to hear it!

data.description:
Smartwatch+ allows you to display additional information on your watch, such as weather, your iPhone's battery status, current stock and Bitcoin prices, your current GPS location, your latest calendar appointments, as well as reminders. Additionally, you can control certain functions of your phone from the watch, such as taking pictures, controlling the music volume, playing a sound to find your phone, and sending HTTP requests for home automation, etc..

Smartwatch+ also supports the httpebble protocol, which lets you use all httpebble-enabled watch apps

latest_release.release_notes:
* added color support for Pebble Time
* small bug fix

data.author: Tjeerd Ytsma

changelog.release_notes:
- Added option to settings on the phone to disable international trains for Belgium.
- Added transfer departures: when your train just departed you can press the up button to quickly count down to your transfer train. Or press the up button long to get a list of transfers for recently departed trains.

New color design for Pebble Time and Pebble Time Round.
A lot of work under the hood, for better performance and to facilitate future updates.

Next Train goes international: added Belgium!
Other new features: 
- auto refresh, the watch vibrates and shows an alert to indicate that there are changes to your currently selected departure 
- recent stations under quick select and in the stations menu 
- show trip time 
- count down to delayed trains 
- an easier way to select stations by there first two letters 
- many more performance improvements

Next Train goes international: added Belgium!
Other new features:
- auto refresh, the watch vibrates and shows an alert to indicate that there are changes to your currently selected departure
- recent stations under quick select and in the stations menu
- show trip time
- count down to delayed trains
- an easier way to select stations by there first two letters
- many more performance improvements
New version numbering required. Real update coming soon!

Bekijk de 5 volgende vertrekken naar je bestemming (druk op 'select'-knop voor het volgende vertrek): 
resterende tijd tot het vertrek, 
spoor, 
vertraging in minuten, 
geplande vertrektijd, 
geplande aankomsttijd, 
aantal overstappen. 
Kies snel uit de 5 dichtstbijzijnde stations ('up'-knop). 
Kies snel uit tot 10 persoonlijke favoriete stations ('down'-knop).
Ververs het huidige reisadvies (houd 'select' 0,5 sec ingedrukt).
Ververs de lijst met dichtstbijzijnde stations (houd 'select' 1,5 sec ingedrukt).
Kies uit alle Nederlandse stations (houd 'up' of 'down' lang ingedrukt).
In een stationslijst: selecteer/verwijder een station als favoriet (houd 'select' lang ingedrukt).

data.description:
Train planner for The Netherlands and Belgium.

The fastest way to see when your train leaves! Immediately see the time counting down to the next departure, on which platform and if it is delayed.
With just one button press you see the next departure times. Or you can select quickly from the nearest stations, your favorites or any other available railway station.

Nederlands
De snelste manier om te zien wanneer je trein vertrekt! Zie direct de tijd aftellen tot je volgende vertrek, op welk spoor en of er vertraging is.
Met n druk op de knop zie je de volgende vertrektijden. Of kan je snel kiezen uit de dichtsbijzijnde stations, je favorieten of alle andere stations.

Franais
Le moyen le plus rapide pour voir quand votre train part! Voyez immdiatement le compte  rebours jusqu' le prochain dpart, de quel quai et si elle est retarde.
Par une simple pression de bouton, vous voyez les prochaines heures de dpart. Ou vous pouvez rapidement slectionner des gares les plus proches, vos favoris ou toutes les autres gares disponibles.
data.title: Next Train

data.author: mjculross

changelog.release_notes:
DblTIme2 - display two timezones

NOTE: to allow full use of the buttons, DblTime2 loads in as an app (at the same menu level as "Settings" on the Pebble), not as a watchface . . . it just displays a watchface

Features (v 2.2):

- dual date & time displays
- with black-on-white for daytime displays & white on black for nighttime displays
- adjustable # hours offset (-23:30 to +23:30) in 30-minute increments, between primary & secondary time displays (default = 0:00)
- when # hours offset = 0, secondary date & time are not displayed (primary time display only)
- enable/disable snooze mode (display blanks after 10 seconds) - default = enable
- enable/disable hourly chime mode (buzzes on the hour & activates display) - default = disable
- selectable mm/dd/yy vs dd/mm/yy date display - default = mm/dd/yy
- enable/disable display of seconds - default = enable
- displays 12/24 hour format time (using current Pebble Settings)
- minimal delay when showing time at start-up & when waking from snooze
- preference settings saved in persistent storage

Operating instructions:

- to enter "set mode" (snooze), long-press the "select" (middle) button (Z's blink)
- with "set mode" on "snooze", press the "up" & "down" buttons to toggle between "enable" & "disable"
- to change "set mode" to "chime", long-press the "select" button (bell blinks)
- with "set mode" on "chime", press the "up" & "down" buttons to toggle between "enable" & "disable"
- to change "set mode" to "month-day", long-press the "select" button (M/D blinks)
- with "set mode" on "month-day", press the "up" & "down" buttons to toggle between mm/dd/yy & dd/mm/yy
- to change "set mode" to "display seconds", long-press the "select" button (S blinks)
- with "set mode" on "display seconds", press the "up" & "down" buttons to toggle between "enable" & "disable"
- to change "set mode" to "offset", long-press the "select" button (TZ blinks)
- with "set mode" on "offset", press the "up" & "down" buttons to adjust the offset value by 30-minute increments
- with "set mode" on "offset", press the "select" button to force the offset back to 0
- to exit "set mode", long-press the "select" button (nothing blinking)
- with "snooze" mode activated (display blank), press the "up" or "down" buttons to repaint the display

Mark J Culross (KD5RXT)
mjculross@sbcglobal.net

data.description: DblTime2: display two configurable timezones

latest_release.release_notes:
DblTIme2 - display two timezones

NOTE: to allow full use of the buttons, DblTime2 loads in as an app (at the same menu level as "Settings" on the Pebble), not as a watchface . . . it just displays a watchface

Features (v 2.2):

- dual date & time displays
- with black-on-white for daytime displays & white on black for nighttime displays
- adjustable # hours offset (-23:30 to +23:30) in 30-minute increments, between primary & secondary time displays (default = 0:00)
- when # hours offset = 0, secondary date & time are not displayed (primary time display only)
- enable/disable snooze mode (display blanks after 10 seconds) - default = enable
- enable/disable hourly chime mode (buzzes on the hour & activates display) - default = disable
- selectable mm/dd/yy vs dd/mm/yy date display - default = mm/dd/yy
- enable/disable display of seconds - default = enable
- displays 12/24 hour format time (using current Pebble Settings)
- minimal delay when showing time at start-up & when waking from snooze
- preference settings saved in persistent storage

Operating instructions:

- to enter "set mode" (snooze), long-press the "select" (middle) button (Z's blink)
- with "set mode" on "snooze", press the "up" & "down" buttons to toggle between "enable" & "disable"
- to change "set mode" to "chime", long-press the "select" button (bell blinks)
- with "set mode" on "chime", press the "up" & "down" buttons to toggle between "enable" & "disable"
- to change "set mode" to "month-day", long-press the "select" button (M/D blinks)
- with "set mode" on "month-day", press the "up" & "down" buttons to toggle between mm/dd/yy & dd/mm/yy
- to change "set mode" to "display seconds", long-press the "select" button (S blinks)
- with "set mode" on "display seconds", press the "up" & "down" buttons to toggle between "enable" & "disable"
- to change "set mode" to "offset", long-press the "select" button (TZ blinks)
- with "set mode" on "offset", press the "up" & "down" buttons to adjust the offset value by 30-minute increments
- with "set mode" on "offset", press the "select" button to force the offset back to 0
- to exit "set mode", long-press the "select" button (nothing blinking)
- with "snooze" mode activated (display blank), press the "up" or "down" buttons to repaint the display

Mark J Culross (KD5RXT)
mjculross@sbcglobal.net

data.title: DblTime2

data.author: mjculross

changelog.release_notes:
TZplus2 - a Pebble watchapp that displays 3 selectable timezones

NOTE: to allow full use of the buttons, TZplus2 loads as an app (at the same menu level as "Settings" on the Pebble), not as a watchface . . . it just displays a watchface

Features (v2.2):

- select and display three timezones, plus local time, selectable on-the-fly
(no recompile required) from a picklist of locations and timezones
- toggle between showing timezone #1 & local time in upper time slot
- uses local time to determine offset from UTC on all displays
- displays nighttime as white characters on black background & daytime as
black characters on white background
- displays +/- 1 to indicate that a particular timezone display is 1-day ahead
or 1-day behind UTC
- displays 12/24 hour format time (using current Pebble Settings)
- preference settings are maintained in persistent storage

Operating instructions:

- to turn backlight on/off (automatically turns off after 4-seconds), either press
"select" (middle) button, or tap/shake
- to toggle between local time and timezone 1 display in the upper slot,
double-click the "select" button (when "set mode" is NOT active)
- to enter "set mode" (local), long-press the "select" (middle) button (upper slot
displays local time, blinks "LOCAL" for 2-seconds, then the currently selected
local timezone blinks)
- with "set mode" on "local", press the "up" & "down" buttons to change the
local timezone (note that the hour & minute displayed for local time may
temporarily change for a second, but will then return since this time
corresponds to either the time sync'd from your phone or the time set in the
Pebble's Settings: Date & Time menu)
- to change "set mode" to "timezone 1", press the "select" button (upper slot
displays timezone 1 time, blinks "TIMEZONE 1" for 2-seconds, then the
currently selected timezone 1 blinks)
- with "set mode" on "timezone 1", press the "up" & "down" buttons to change
timezone 1 (note that the time for timezone 1 will adjust in sync with the
selected timezone to reflect the offset from UTC, taking into consideration the
local offset from UTC selected earlier)
- to change "set mode" to "timezone 2", press the "select" button (the currently
selected timezone 2 blinks in the middle slot)
- with "set mode" on "timezone 2", press the "up" & "down" buttons to change
timezone 2 (note that the time for timezone 2 will adjust in sync with the
selected timezone to reflect the offset from UTC, taking into consideration the
local offset from UTC selected earlier)
- to change "set mode" to "timezone 3", press the "select" button (the currently
selected timezone 3 blinks in the lower slot)
- with "set mode" on "timezone 3", press the "up" & "down" buttons to change
timezone 3 (note that the time for timezone 3 will adjust in sync with the
selected timezone to reflect the offset from UTC, taking into consideration the
local offset from UTC selected earlier)
- to change "set mode" to "local", press the "select" button (upper slot displays
local time, blinks "LOCAL" for 2-seconds, then the currently selected local
timezone blinks)
- to exit "set mode" at anytime, long-press the "select" button (nothing blinking)

Mark J Culross (KD5RXT)
mjculross@sbcglobal.net

data.description: TZplus2: display multiple configurable timezones

data.author: Torivon

changelog.release_notes: * Adding Diorite support
* Fixed a bug when fighting the dragon. Forcing the game to close with the back button and reentering could cause the player to be fighting a different monster or no monster.
* Add feature to revert to original graphics
Update for firmware 3.8

Adds:
* Support for Pebble, Pebble Time, and Pebble Time Round, including new art for both Monochrome and Color.
* Optional background app to explore while you use other apps and watchfaces. The background app can interrupt you when an event happens or save it for the next time you want to play.
* Menus now wrap top to bottom.
* Battery percent listed in pause menu.

Bug fixes:
* Fixed crash if notifications were left up on top of MiniDungeon.
* Stat points available to spend were not persisted.
* The final boss gave a negative gold reward.
Fixing memory leak of background image once per execution.

data.description:
Explore a dungeon as you go about your day. Exploring is randomized and time based, so you only act when an event is triggered. Encounter random monsters and chests. Survive, and you can advance deeper into the dungeon. 

Controls:
Use the up, down, and select buttons to activate the menu options on the right of the screen. The back button will exit sub-menus, and exit the app when you are at the main adventure screen. If you are in battle and need to exit in a hurry, holding the back button will force exit the game. 

Features:
* Support for Pebble, Pebble Time, Pebble Time Round, and Pebble 2.
* Automatically saves progress on exiting, including the state of combat in the case of a force exit.
* Optional vibration when an event happens.
* Optional fast mode to speed up events. It does not change the relative frequency of event types, but makes the game faster if you have some dedicated play time.
* Optional background app to explore while you use other apps and watchfaces. The background app can interrupt you when an event happens or save it for the next time you want to play.
* Option to revert to original graphics

Full code is available on GitHub. 
Additional Contributors:
* BlackLamb
* Belphemur
data.title: MiniDungeon

data.author: mjculross

changelog.release_notes:
Ricochet2: time and date bounce around the screen and ricochet off of each other.

NOTE: to allow full use of the buttons, Ricochet2 loads in as an app (at the same level as "Settings" on the Pebble), not as a watchface...it just displays a watchface

Features (v2.3):
- selectable white-on-black or black-on-white display
- selectable date-on-top or time-on-top display mode
- selectable 12/24 hour format time
- selectable mm/dd/yy or dd/mm/yy format date
- preference settings are maintained in persistent storage

Operating Instructions:
- to toggle between black-on-white and white-on-black displays, long-press the "select" button
- to toggle between date-on-top and time-on-top display mode, double-click the "select" button (also freezes the display for 4-seconds)
- to toggle between 12/24 hour format time, press the "down" button
- to toggle between mm/dd/yy and dd/mm/yy date format, press the "up" button
- to turn the backlight on/off (automatically turns off after 4-seconds), either press the "select" button, or tap/shake (also freezes the display for 4-seconds)

Mark J Culross (KD5RXT)
mjculross@sbcglobal.net

data.description: Ricochet2: time & date bounce around the screen & ricochet off of each other

PebbleApps is a set of 5 useful and simple applets for your Pebble SmartWatch.

- Weather : 7-day weather forecast
  * OpenWeatherMaps
  * Yahoo! Weather
- SMS : 
  * Full access to your SMS Inbox
  * Answer with canned messages
- Agenda : Upcoming Agenda events (Android 4.0+ only)
- Utils applet :
  * Phone battery and network info
  * Find my phone
  * Remote camer

The app displays a chronometer and you can go back/forth in your slides using the Up and Down buttons. Follow the install instructions on https://github.com/luisivan/pebble-slides/blob/master/README.md

data.description:
The Interval Trainer tracks elapsed time and interval times.  You can set two intervals which are repeated as time elapses.  A vibration alerts you when an interval changes, and the numbers are BIG for easy reading while exercising.

The interval minutes and seconds are customizable, as are the vibration alerts, screen background, etc. Press the middle button or choose Setting from your smart phone.

data.description: Rudd is an app for Pebble that helps you manage time by vibrating on a set interval. When you're working out for a given interval, don't keep checking your watch, set Rudd for 1-2 minutes. Time flies when you're having fun, but drags on when you're bored, so set Rudd to 5-15 minutes to give your mind a new perception of time. Set Rudd for 30-60 minutes to remind yourself to take a study break.
data.title: Rudd

data.description:
Having trouble seeing those small numbers while exercising? Try the Big Number Stopwatch and be able to check the elapsed time quickly.

Press the bottom bottom for start/stop and the top button to reset the time. Pressing the middle button momentarily shows the current time, and a long press raises the settings menu.

Customizable settings are available, plus the time is restored if you briefly switch apps.
data.title: Big Stopwatch

changelog.release_notes:
- Pebble Round support.
- Compiled with Pebble SDK 3.0
- Title header.
- Notification of "incoming medication" and "connection failed".
- Minor design changes.

- Pebble Round support.
- Compiled with Pebble SDK 3.0
- Minor design changes.

- Colors everywhere!
- Solved bug: new PebbleKit or maybe the Pebble Time had changed something in data syncing that now works again as expected.

- Removed the title on status bar. The new firmware manage it.
- Changed app name from Pebble Pillbox to Pillbox for Pebble.

- Better medication description splitting it in two lines (name, units).
- It shows time to medication in minutes between -128 and 127 (1 byte).
- Major improvements on companion Android app.

data.description: This application will ensure that you or the people around you never forget to take the prescribed medication. Define what to take, when and how often, and forget about it. Pillbox for Pebble will issue reminders in time and remember if you confirm, cancel or delay the consumption.

latest_release.release_notes:
- Pebble Round support.
- Compiled with Pebble SDK 3.0
- Title header.
- Notification of "incoming medication" and "connection failed".
- Minor design changes.

data.title: Pillbox for Pebble

data.author: Orologics

changelog.release_notes: 2.7 Fixed a bug where single route filtering would switch routes. Single routes are now presented in sort order.
2.6 Text centering for compatibility with round watch faces.
2.5 Slight improvement to menu drawing speed. Code cleanup.
2.4 fixes the missing menu text on Pebble Time.
Temporary workaround for Pebble Time only showing the first stop: press select on the stops with missing titles.
2.2 Push select button to cycle through each of the routes at a stop.
2.1 Removed unnecessary code.

2.0 Complete re-write. Now uses stop IDs for easier configuration. Stop IDs are posted at each bus stop, or got to nextbus.com to look them up. The new configuration screen fixes the cascading drop down problem. Up to 8 stops can be defined. After choosing a stop, all routes that go to that stop show their predicted arrival times and additional details when scrolled down.
1.1 Automatic updates versioning
No functional change. URL to configuration changed.

1.0.1 Code cleanup and minor improvements
1.02 Fix crash with 2.0 FC firmware

data.description: Real-time arrival predictions for up to 8 bus and metro stops provided by NextBus! Works for over 60 US and Canadian public transit districts. Shows arrival times for all routes at a given stop. Or, repeatedly press select button to choose your preferred route at that stop. Check out my other transit apps for the following regions and agencies: SF Bay Area (10 Agencies), BART, New York MTA Bus, WMATA Bus & Rail, and Vancouver BC Bus.

latest_release.release_notes: 2.7 Fixed a bug where single route filtering would switch routes. Single routes are now presented in sort order.

data.title: My Bus

data.author: Word to the Wise

data.author: jeffsteinke

changelog.release_notes:
- Smashed some bugs on the golf cart windshield. 
- Took off the cart's governor to improve performance.
- Renamed app from "Pebble Golf App" to "ParAid Golf App" to comply with Pebble's Trademark policy.

Keep sending the feedback to @jeff_steinke so we can keep making the best Pebble golf scorecard app even better!
Release 1.0

data.description:
Tired of crummy golf course pencils breaking, or flying off your cart as you pull a tight turn around the eighth green?

ParAid Golf App is a nifty golf scorecard app:
- Standalone app - no phone needed
- Saves last round's score
- Tracks round as you go so you know how bad of shape you're in before you even hit the turn
- Limit of 9 shots a hole, guaranteeing you'll shoot below 163!

latest_release.release_notes:
- Smashed some bugs on the golf cart windshield. 
- Took off the cart's governor to improve performance.
- Renamed app from "Pebble Golf App" to "ParAid Golf App" to comply with Pebble's Trademark policy.

Keep sending the feedback to @jeff_steinke so we can keep making the best Pebble golf scorecard app even better!

data.title: ParAid Golf App

data.author: cstrat

changelog.release_notes: Updated to prevent timer crashes.

data.description:
Keep track of your tennis match with ease, for free!

- Highly configurable
- Config and game data saves locally
- Allows for multiple game lengths
- Tiebreak/NoAd/ProScore modes
- Serve tracking
- Unlimited undo's

Plenty more features will be coming to Tennis Pro in coming releases.
data.title: Tennis Pro

data.author: FawzmaGames

changelog.release_notes: Initial release

data.description:
Try to keep as many dinkys in the air as you can. Be careful though; you can only miss 3 times, then game over.

Don't forget to check out my other game DinkyPop and the watchface, In and Out.

Please leave <3's
data.title: DinkyDrop

data.author: tgwaste
data.description:
The classic game is back!  Destroy the asteroids before they destroy you!

Instructions:
Up/Down - Turn ship left/right
Select - Fire
Long Press Select - Thrusters

At the title screen you may do:
Up - Add more lives
Down - Toggle Hardcore/God Mode

Please Donate: http://bit.ly/tgdonate
data.title: Asteroids

data.author: Armando Prez Abad
data.description:
Play 'PebbleBan', the great classic Soukoban (Warehouse Keeper) in your Pebble.

Including these nice features to provide a joyful experience:

- 50 small levels
- UNDO
- Save State

Do you dare to tidy all 50 warehouses?
Can you achieve it in fewer movements?
data.title: PebbleBan

data.author: Amaan

changelog.release_notes: Initial Release of C25K

data.description:
A simple Watchapp that provides users with timers for each interval of the popular Couch to 5K running program.

It features each workout for each of the 9 weeks, so you can simply select which workout you are at, and the timer begins. You will be alerted with a vibration when the current interval is done.
data.title: C25K - Couch to 5K

A toothbrush timer. 

We can't all waste $150 on an electric toothbrush, but we can get one of the primary benefits of an electric toothbrush with a tiny little Pebble app.

Time your toothbrushing with too easy modes to get on your way towards cleaner, whiter teeth.

data.author: Pocket Mariner Ltd.

changelog.release_notes:
Boat and Wind speeds now show accurate to 1 decimal place (e.g. 4.6 Kts iso 5Kts).
Apparent Wind Angle now displayed as an angle relative to the boats heading rather than a bearing.
Stability improvements.
2.0.1: Fixed layout issues for Pebble 2.0 Beta 7

data.description: SeaNav Pebble connects to SeaNav US or SeaNav UK & Ireland on your iPhone or iPad and provides live navigation data on your wrist wherever you are on your boat. See http://seanav.net/demo/PebbleUserGuide.php for details.

latest_release.release_notes:
Boat and Wind speeds now show accurate to 1 decimal place (e.g. 4.6 Kts iso 5Kts).
Apparent Wind Angle now displayed as an angle relative to the boats heading rather than a bearing.
Stability improvements.

data.author: Ducky Software
data.description: 4-Across, the classic "Connect Four" style game, is now available on the Pebble Watch.  The game is implemented as you against the computer on a 7x6 grid.  The computer is no slouch.  It knows every solution that you can play to win the game and will actively block your pursuits while also analyzing the board and taking the best position.

data.author: FawzmaGames

changelog.release_notes: Increased tutorial font size a bit.

data.description:
DinkyPop is a super simple ball popping experience! Angle your watch to move your ball to a spot you want.

How to play

Look for a time where you think you can catch the most balls. Pick your target and press any button. Your ball will start to grow. Any other ball moving in the way of your ball, will start to grow to grow, so on and so forth.

latest_release.release_notes: Increased tutorial font size a bit.
